page.title: 02BERWICK LIFEBOAT STATION
page.content: Boats and Launching. The lifeboat station was built in 1835.It is 150 years old this year.The early lifeboats were wooden and were rowed or sailed out to sea.Today's boat is smaller,lighter and faster.It is an inflatable,inshore type made from rubber and glassfibre.It weighs 1.5 tons.It has two outboard motors, each of 60 H.P.A top speed of 35knots and fuel for 100 miles. It is equipped with V.H.F.radio,compass,echo sounder, First Aid and oars in case both engines fail. It is launched on a trolley down a slipway. The engines are started even before the shed doors are opened.The trolley carries its own water supply to cool the engines. A winch hauls the trolley and boat back up the slipway when it returns.It is then made ready for the next time it will be needed.
